availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Thomas Pollard (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Pollard and Sally Runyon Pollard. Resident in Garrard County in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1850. Farmer in Garrard County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Garrard County in 1860. Served in the 19th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private and corporal from January 2, 1862, to October 4, 1863. Transferred to Veteran Reserve Corps (U.S.A.) on April 10, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 1, p. 249A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, District 1, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 679.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 13.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0324.
Indiana, U.S. Death Certificates, 1899-2011, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, IN, 1923, Roll 5, p. 1746.
Find A Grave, "George Thomas Pollard (1844-1923)," Memorial #41759278, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41759278 (accessed January 2, 2021).
